TopicTitle: Space Shuttle Pack for ksp 1.0.4 dev thread

Articles.Content:
Yes sorry bout all the mixups. I WAS ment to fix enginemount2... I know exactly what you mean. Its a 10min job that I keep leaving till im too tired to work on my other things. I will still place a link to it here with instructions this time.

If this new engine mount with the body flap works should we remove the origional one?

Tonight i will stick to my plan in order of:

1. Engine mount and right click menus for tail control

2. Wheels.

3. One piece orbiter or dreamchaser.

4. ISS fixing
Yes remove the other one. All the shuttles had a movable flap

Does anyone of you know where in the cockpit the autopilot controls where located? I want to make buttons for SAS like Prograge, Target etc. I just cannot find their RL location.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T05:16:12Z" title="06/09/2015 05:16  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by Jeast**

@Jeast, here you can find everything about the Shuttle's Cockpit: [http://www.nasa.gov/centers/johnson/pdf/390651main_shuttle_crew_operations_manual.pdf](http://www.nasa.gov/centers/johnson/pdf/390651main_shuttle_crew_operations_manual.pdf)

> 
> Yes remove the other one. All the shuttles had a movable flap

DONE!

I can release a simplified full release tonight if you like.

remove unused boosters

remove original engine mount

include new tail

remove fuel dump valve

remove windowless cockpit?

anything else let me know

Im really stoked to see the future versions of this. As much as im seeing people complain and sometimes get ahead of themselves i will say Mike you are doing a great job. I have fully built a ISS size space station of my own i have been working on since Friday. All using the work you have done on the shuttle. As of course all things can use improvements if you pick it enough i think you did a dang good job and i signed into to the forums just to tell you that. Keep up the great work and im looking forward to the future of the CSS.

> 
> DONE!
> I can release a simplified full release tonight if you like.
> 
> remove unused boosters
> 
> remove original engine mount
> 
> include new tail
> 
> remove fuel dump valve
> 
> remove windowless cockpit?
> 
> anything else let me know

Great idea,

If you send it to me first I can include the mini avc versioncheck stuff

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> @Jeast, here you can find everything about the Shuttle's Cockpit: [http://www.nasa.gov/centers/johnson/pdf/390651main_shuttle_crew_operations_manual.pdf](http://www.nasa.gov/centers/johnson/pdf/390651main_shuttle_crew_operations_manual.pdf)

Thanks, I have found the right spot.

Hell, I wanted to do my version of the space shuttle, but I think you're working day and night on this project, I do not have so much free time ... :-)

I'll give you all that I could do more for the version of the Dragon, which he has not released. Perhaps these changes will help you.

Dark texture, also appeared radiators.

[![8980470_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433836008/8d197755/8980470_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/8d1977558980470.html)

[![8980509_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433836211/1716decd/8980509_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/1716decd8980509.html)

 Radiators, wings, control surfaces, OMS tanks, body flap is removed.

[![8980559_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433836574/86fdb504/8980559_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/86fdb5048980559.html)

 The tail is more inclined, which corresponds to reality.

[![8980611_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433836719/a280f258/8980611_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/a280f2588980611.html)

 Lower tile from / to the airport re teksturirovaniya.Et cover.

[![8980626_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433836829/f8171847/8980626_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/f81718478980626.html)

Light.

[![8980722_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433837289/32481846/8980722_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/324818468980722.html)

 Ah yes, the body flap works ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

[![8980683_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433837051/e12594dd/8980683_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/e12594dd8980683.html)

[![8980692_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1433837133/7808c98f/8980692_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/7808c98f8980692.html)

 I think they can be very useful, especially the wings. Perhaps today, I will send them to you, unless of course you need these changes.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T08:27:25Z" title="06/09/2015 08:27  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by DECQ**
WOW the TPS textures on the belly of the shuttle look amazing:confused:

> 
> snip

Looks cool man i see your launching it with energia instead of the ET/SRB setup. Is that due to incompatibility?. I like the solar panels (as an option) even though i do not believe the US ever used that setup. With all respect to bobcat it would be great to see a upgraded Buran which this seems to have many features of.

it is ok. a lot of parts. can someone translate?

is this the one we have been waiting for? im interested

Damn translator buggy, restarted page English ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Looks cool man i see your launching it with energia instead of the ET/SRB setup. Is that due to incompatibility?. I like the solar panels (as an option) even though i do not believe the US ever used that setup. With all respect to bobcat it would be great to see a upgraded Buran which this seems to have many features of.

1.Energy is easier to fly

2.is not solar panels ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)

> 
> Looks cool man i see your launching it with energia instead of the ET/SRB setup. Is that due to incompatibility?. I like the solar panels (as an option) even though i do not believe the US ever used that setup. With all respect to bobcat it would be great to see a upgraded Buran which this seems to have many features of.

They aren't solar panels. They are radiators which dissipated heat produced by the shuttle. Shuttle used fuel cells to generate power.

Translated

Imho you may keep the windowed cockpit. The multipart cockpit is nostalgic, but most players wont use it due to lazyness. And i guessit is a pain to maintain it, seemless texturizing and stuff. 

About the kerbals visble through the windows: nli2work did some transparent pods, maybe you could use that dependant on his licensing. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I have put in actual glass to the cockpit, and by adding a light it will also illuminate realistically.

and I think he went with the external command seat inside glass panels idea, so there will be no proper iva

- - - Updated - - -

GOOD WORK DECQ!

is that how the original shuttle was ment to be?
I dont really see any need for the high part count but i really like the textures.

The glass on the cockpit on DECQ's Shuttle reminds me of this CSS cockpit from way back when.

 ![KCSS_1.jpg](http://i511.photobucket.com/albums/s354/icemotoboy/KCSS_1.jpg)

Not sure if I want to go back to these

im not sure either, but lemme see mikes glass first ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) after i fed my daughter, she is dishing out terror ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)
but its a texture, not glass. I mean not see through
I can make it see through if you like. I'm pretty experienced with RPM by now.

you mean [https://github.com/Mihara/RasterPropMonitor/wiki/Part-modules](https://github.com/Mihara/RasterPropMonitor/wiki/Part-modules)

- - - Updated - - -

I was just going for the transparent texture for the windows cockpit for now. but youre welcome to give it a go.

I will upload the full update tonight fixing the engine mount and rcs, also removing parts

Isnt it almost night at your place? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
